Inn Fang wrote:
> I thought all ARC files have the same format. Am I right?
> (But seems like the ARC files generated by Heritrix is different than 
> others.)

Unfortunately, there are other compressed aggregate file type
out there that use the ARC extension, dating back all the way
to DOS and early Mac, which can lead to confusion.

The ARC format Heritrix writes is only that described at the
link Stack mentioned, and the specification it links to:

  http://crawler.archive.org/articles/developer_manual.html#arcs
  http://www.archive.org/web/researcher/ArcFileFormat.php

You can uncompress a compressed arc.gz with gunzip or just about
any compression utility that reads gzip files -- but this results
in one big .arc file.

If you want to 'unroll' the ARC into a file-per-URL, choosing
practical filenames for every URL can be tricky, and links
between files will only inconsistently work unless you do
fairly intrusive rewriting of the original content where necessary.

We can't yet recommend any good tool for doing this.

- Gordon @ IA
